maml:description.maml:para: Uses the hunter.io api to return all email addresses that could be found associated with a particular domain or company name.

Uses the hunter.io api to return all email addresses that could be found associated with a particular domain or company name. Can only return increments of 100, but if the offset parameter is omitted, this function will collect all emails found.

maml:Description.maml:para: The company name from which you want to find the email addresses.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Get only email addresses for people working in the selected department(s).
Specifies the number of email addresses to skip. In other words, from where in the list of the total number of emails do you want to obtain the 100 emails that each query is limited to?
Get only email addresses for people with the selected seniority level.
Get only personal or generic email addresses. Do not include to search both.
Domain name from which you want to find the email addresses. For example, "stripe.com".
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Get only email addresses for people working in the selected department(s).
Specifies the number of email addresses to skip. In other words, from where in the list of the total number of emails do you want to obtain the 100 emails that each query is limited to?
Get only email addresses for people with the selected seniority level.
Get only personal or generic email addresses. Do not include to search both.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
The company name from which you want to find the email addresses.
Get only email addresses for people working in the selected department(s).
Domain name from which you want to find the email addresses. For example, "stripe.com".
Specifies the number of email addresses to skip. In other words, from where in the list of the total number of emails do you want to obtain the 100 emails that each query is limited to?
Get only email addresses for people with the selected seniority level.
Get only personal or generic email addresses. Do not include to search both.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Returns all email addresses for all departments and all seniority levels the hunter api can find for the domain github.com

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> find-domainemails -company Walmart -type personal -seniority senior -department "it" -offset 0

dev:remarks.maml:para: Returns only the first 100 personal emails of senior associates in the IT department that the hunter api can find for the company walmart.

maml:description.maml:para: This function generates or retrieves the most likely email address from a domain name, a first name and a last name.
This function generates or retrieves the most likely email address from a domain name, a first name and a last name.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command will use the hunter api to generate the most likely HomeDepot.com email address for the individual John Doe
This command will use the hunter api to generate the most likely email address associated with Subway for the individual Steven Colbert.

maml:description.maml:para: This function enables you to get information regarding your Hunter account at any time.
This function enables you to get information regarding your Hunter account at any time.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command will return the account info associated with the api key you imported.

maml:description.maml:para: This function returns the number of email addresses the hunter api is able to find for one domain or for one company.
This function returns the number of email addresses the hunter api is able to find for one domain or for one company.

maml:Description.maml:para: The company name for which you want to know how many email addresses the hunter api can find

dev:remarks.maml:para: Returns the number of email addresses the hunter api found for the domain whitehouse.gov

maml:description.maml:para: Imports your api token into powershell. This is required in order to utilize the hunter api.

Imports your api token into powershell. This is required in order to utilize the hunter api. You only have the run this command once. If you don't provide your api key as a parameter, the function will prompt you for it. In order to obtain an api key, you must register for an account on https://hunter.io

maml:Description.maml:para: Your api key.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Your api key.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Imports and stores the fictitious and invalid api key "0000000000000000000000000000" for use by the hunter api and this module.

maml:description.maml:para: This function allows you to verify the deliverability of an email address.

This function allows you to verify the deliverability of an email address. Hunter focuses on B2B. Therefore, webmails are not verified. The hunter api will run every check but won't reach the remote SMTP server.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Checks the deliverability of the email address "john.doe@microsoft.com"
